noun.description: Mineralogy. A calcium aluminium silicate of the mica group, CaAl₄Si₂O₁₀(OH)₂, usually occurring as minute scales with a pearly lustre. Formerly also called pearl mica.
Geology A line of globulites resembling a string of pearls, commonly occurring in glassy igneous rocks.

origin: Early 19th century. From German Margarit from Hellenistic Greek μάργαρον pearl + German -it.
